channel.title: Linking NPC Dialogue
channel.description:
I was wondering how I would link together different types of dialogue to the same NPC to be re-occuring so..After you "Click here to continue" the next message will appear.
[code] case 111: c.talk("Hi! I have to decided to visit Kronic-Scape", 1552); break; case 112: c.talk3("I have a dinner party with the rest of the holiday event people", "very soon but I've forgot to bring the turkey.", "I was wondering if you could help me?", 1552); break;[/code]
I want to link them two together so that once you have clicked to contine the second message will appear.
Thanks for in a future reference.
- SmD

item.title: Linking NPC Dialogue
item.dc:creator: @SmDaRgOn SmDaRgOn
item.description:
@SmDaRgOn wrote:

[quote=“The Soul, post:9, topic:321955”][quote author=SmDaRgOn link=topic=418375.msg3075026#msg3075026 date=1261766283]

Well with the source I am using (deltascape) this is already added with the linked npc dialogue, I was just wondering how I could add to it with newly added NPC dialogue.

It should be, I was just making suggestions for improving the code. Having one large if-statement is ugly.

Okay…I just want to know how to add more of the noc dialogue to this list that is there already.
[/quote]

Then take a look at Owned_pl0xs’ post…[/quote]

I tried that and it failed…Instead of it showing the first dialogue it just skipped to the next dialogue.

Read full topic

item.title: Linking NPC Dialogue
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

When using ‘linked NPC dialogue’ in packet 40 it should be handled via array like so:

int[] npcdiag = {ids here};

and then

public boolean continue(int id) { for(int i : npcdiag) { return i == id ? true : false; } }

if(continue(NpcDialogue)) { NpcDialogue++; }

Read full topic

In the Client class (Client.Java).

item.title: Linking NPC Dialogue
item.dc:creator: @SmDaRgOn SmDaRgOn
item.description:
@SmDaRgOn wrote:

[quote=“Owned_Pl0xs, post:2, topic:321955”]In case 40, in your paseIncomingPackets method, add this.

if(NpcDialogue == 111) { NpcDialogue++; }[/quote]

This may be a very nooby question but where is paseIncomingPackets method?

Read full topic
